These are examples of creating heatmaps with ***ggplot2*** package. For more examples on constructing heatmaps, see my answer on Stack Overflow [my answer on Stack Overflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/34301152/creating-heatmap-graph-in-r/34302517#34302517)

```{r, echo=TRUE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
# Load packages----
require(data.table)
require(ggplot2)

set.seed(100)

# Data----
n.row <- 10
n.col <- 8
n.grp <- 2

dt1 <- data.table(rowVar = factor(paste("Row",
                                        rep(LETTERS[1:n.row],
                                            n.col))),
                  colVar = factor(paste("Column",
                                        rep(rev(LETTERS[1:n.col]),
                                            each = n.row))),
                  grpVar = factor(paste("Group",
                                        sample(1:2,
                                               n.row*n.col,
                                               replace = TRUE))),
                  valVar = rnorm(n.row*n.col))
print(dt1)

# Plot heatmap----
p1 <- ggplot(data = dt1) +
  geom_tile(aes(x =  colVar,
                y = rowVar,
                fill = valVar),
            color = "black") +
  scale_fill_gradient2(low = "red", 
                       high = "green", 
                       mid = "black", 
                       midpoint = 0, 
                       # limit = c(-10, 10), 
                       name = "Magnitude") +
  scale_x_discrete("Column Variable",
                   expand = c(0, 0)) + 
  scale_y_discrete("Row Variable",
                   expand = c(0, 0)) +
  ggtitle("Heatmap") +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 20,
                                   hjust = 1),
        # legend.position = "top",
        plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5))
print(p1)

# Save the plot as a TIFF file
# tiff(filename = "tmp/heatmap.tiff",
#      height = 10,
#      width = 8,
#      units = 'in',
#      res = 300,
#      compression = "lzw+p")
# print(p1)
# graphics.off()

# Plot heatmap with grouping variable----
p2 <- ggplot(data = dt1) +
  facet_wrap(~ grpVar,
             scales = "free_y") +
  geom_tile(aes(x =  colVar,
                y = rowVar,
                fill = valVar),
            color = "black") +
  scale_fill_gradient2(low = "red", 
                       high = "green", 
                       mid = "black", 
                       midpoint = 0, 
                       # limit = c(-10, 10), 
                       name = "Magnitude") +
  scale_x_discrete("Column Variable",
                   expand = c(0, 0)) + 
  scale_y_discrete("Row Variable",
                   expand = c(0, 0)) +
  ggtitle("Heatmap") + 
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 20,
                                   hjust = 1),
        # legend.position = "top",
        plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5))
print(p2)
```
